crazyballrun.game.level.objects

Class LevelObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • crazyballrun.game.level.objects.LevelObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleCar, SimpleRocket

    public abstract class LevelObject
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class defines basic functionality of static and moving objects in a level. It also represents the relationship between physical and visual model of the object (the physics engine uses the RigidBody for collision detection, while the graphics engine uses the Animation for rendering).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      All possible state of a level object.

      • mLevel

        protected Level mLevel
        Reference to the current level.

      • mState

        protected LevelObject.ObjectState mState
        Current state of the object. Do not change the state of the object in subclasses (just if you really know what you're doing, which is probably NOT the case!)!

      • mObjectModel

        protected PhysicalBody mObjectModel
        Physical model of the object.

      • getController

        public ObjectController getController()
        Gets a (threadsafe) reference to the ObjectController.
        Returns:
        object controlling unit

      • control

        public void control(int dt,
           double dt_sec)
        Forces the object's controller to perform an action. If there is no internal controller this method will anyway perform all of the attached effects.
        Parameters:
        dt - time passed since the last call (in miliseconds)
        dt_sec - time passed since the last call (in seconds)

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the object after change of physics. Therefore, the object will be moved into the Tile covered by its center point and the position of the animation of the object is synchronized with the physical position of the object. This method has to be called by the PhysicsThread. The update method also updates the current state of the object and applies actions due to its controller.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Removes the object from the level and creates a death animation if available.

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Checks if the level-object is still alive or should be removed from the level's object-list.
        Returns:
        "true" if alive

      • getObjectModel

        public PhysicalBody getObjectModel()
        Gets the physical model of the object.
        Returns:
        a reference to the RigidBody-instance of the object.

      • clone

        public LevelObject clone()
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

        public void set(java.lang.String property,
       java.lang.String value)
        Sets a property to a particular value.
        Parameters:
        property - property name
        value - property value

      • getAnimation

        public abstract Animation getAnimation()
        Finds the current animation of the object due to its state.
        Returns:
        the current object animation.

      • setProperty

        public abstract void setProperty(java.lang.String property,
               java.lang.String value)
        Sets one of the object's properties.
        Parameters:
        property - property name
        value - value for the property

      • initialize

        public abstract void initialize()
        Initializes the LevelObject. This method is called after all of the properties are set.

      • onCollision

        public abstract void onCollision(LevelObject obj)
        This method defines effects happening after a collision with another object or with a texture. If a collision with a texture occured, the obj-argument is null.
        Parameters:
        obj - reference to the other rigid body/object
